title: How to Do a Fish Tail Plait for Beginners

steps.title: Brush out your hair completely.
steps.content: Brush out your hair completely. Remove any tangles and brush your hair smooth.

steps.title: Split your hair down the middle.
steps.content: Split your hair down the middle. Divide it into two large sections with the part running straight down the middle. [1] X Expert Source Sarah Kosakowski Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 3 September 2021. Use the tip of a comb to make the part look neat. Hold one section of hair in each hand. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Take a small strand from the outside of the left section.
steps.content: Take a small strand from the outside of the left section. The smaller the strand, the finer your braid will be. If you're in a hurry, grab a bigger strand.

steps.title: Pull it to the inside of the right section.
steps.content: Pull it to the inside of the right section. Cross it over to the other side and place in the other section.

steps.title: Repeat on the right side.
steps.content: Repeat on the right side. Take a strand from the outside of the right section and move it to the inside of the left section. For a neat-looking braid, make sure the strand is the same size as the previous strand you moved.

steps.title: Alternate sides until you reach the end of the plait.
steps.content: Alternate sides until you reach the end of the plait. Keep taking small strands of hair from each side and crossing them over to the other side. [3] X Expert Source Sarah Kosakowski Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 3 September 2021. As you work, pull the plait tight to keep the strands from getting too loose and falling out.

steps.title: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place.
steps.content: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place. Use an elastic, a ribbon or a hair bobble. [4] X Expert Source Sarah Kosakowski Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 3 September 2021.

steps.title: Separate a section of hair from the crown of your head.
steps.content: Separate a section of hair from the crown of your head. Take a handful of hair from the crown, just as you would when starting a regular French braid .

steps.title: Divide it in half.
steps.content: Divide it in half. Split it into two equal parts, and hold one half in each hand.

steps.title: Take a strand of hair from the left side of your hairline.
steps.content: Take a strand of hair from the left side of your hairline. Just as you would for a regular French braid, choose a small strand to start the plait.

steps.title: Weave it over the left section and under the right section.
steps.content: Weave it over the left section and under the right section. Hold it in your right hand so it becomes part of the right section.

steps.title: Take a strand from the right side of your hairline.
steps.content: Take a strand from the right side of your hairline. It should be the same size as the strand you took from the other side.

steps.title: Weave it over the right section and under the left section.
steps.content: Weave it over the right section and under the left section. Hold it in your left hand so it becomes part of the left section.

steps.title: Alternate sides until you run out of hair.
steps.content: Alternate sides until you run out of hair. Keep taking strands from the sides of your head and weaving them into the fishtail. You'll see an intricate, beautiful braid begin to form.

steps.title: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place.
steps.content: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place. Use an elastic, a ribbon or a hair bobble.

steps.title: Put your hair into a side ponytail.
steps.content: Put your hair into a side ponytail. Comb it down and to the side, under either your right or left ear. Secure it in place with an elastic hair tie you don't mind breaking, since you'll be cutting it off later. The hair tie will make it much easier to plait your hair on the side.

steps.title: Separate your ponytail into two sections.
steps.content: Separate your ponytail into two sections. Create two equal sections and hold one in each hand.

steps.title: Take a strand from the outside of the left section.
steps.content: Take a strand from the outside of the left section. You're using the same method you used to make the basic Fishtail braid.

steps.title: Move it to the inside of the right section.
steps.content: Move it to the inside of the right section. Hold it in place with your right hand.

steps.title: Take a strand from the outside of the right section.
steps.content: Take a strand from the outside of the right section. It should be the same size as the strand you took from the left side.

steps.title: Move it to the inside of the left section.
steps.content: Move it to the inside of the left section. Hold it in place with your left hand.

steps.title: Repeat until you run out of hair.
steps.content: Repeat until you run out of hair. Plait your fishtail all the way to the end, going back and forth between the left and right sides.

steps.title: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place.
steps.content: Tie off the end to keep the plait in place. Use an elastic, a ribbon or a hair bobble.

steps.title: Snip off the top hair tie.
steps.content: Snip off the top hair tie. Now the top of your plait will look loose and natural.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
